item.title: 英国解除对巴基斯坦航班的禁令，促进巴基斯坦航空公司的销售前景
item.description: 英国航空当局在大约五年后取消了对巴基斯坦航空公司在英国运营的限制，因为这个南亚国家已经达到了英国的安全标准。【原文：British aviation authorities have lifted restrictions on Pakistani carriers to operate in the UK after about five years as the South Asian nation has complied with their safety standards.】

item.title: 有关环境灾难的新诉讼加剧了 Braskem 公司债券的困境
item.description: 在巴西阿拉戈斯州就该公司一座矿山坍塌造成的损失提起 40 亿雷亚尔（7.17 亿美元）的诉讼后，Braskem SA 公司的美元债券再次面临压力。【原文：Braskem SA’s dollar bonds are under renewed pressure after the Brazilian state of Alagoas filed a 4 billion-real ($717 million) lawsuit tied to damage caused by the collapse of one of the company’s mines.】

item.title: 美联储巴尔警告繁荣和萧条与银行规则削弱有关
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）强调，监管必须随着金融体系的发展而发展，并在特朗普时代的官员们寻求放宽对大银行的规定并转向更宽松的监管之际发出了警告。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr emphasized that regulation must evolve with the financial system, issuing a warning as Trump-era officials look to ease rules for big banks and shift to a lighter touch.】

item.title: 全球最令人担忧的经济图表
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 房价飙升，西班牙本季度住房供应量骤降 20
item.description: 西班牙主要房地产网站上的待售房屋数量在第二季度下降了 20%，这是至少自 2007 年以来的最大降幅，表明该国在解决住房紧张问题上面临挑战。【原文：The number of homes for sale on Spain’s main real estate listings website fell by 20% in the second quarter, the biggest drop since at least 2007 and a sign of the challenge the country faces to address its housing crunch.】

item.title: 芯片制造商亏损抵消银行业乐观业绩，S&P 500 指数下跌
item.description: 周三，S&P 500 指数在小幅上涨和下跌之间徘徊，芯片制造商的下跌抑制了更广泛的涨幅，因为交易员们在分析冷却的生产者价格和大银行的一系列利润更新。【原文：The S&P 500 Index shuffled between small gains and losses on Wednesday, as a decline in chipmakers kept broader gains in check as traders parsed cooling producer prices and a string of profit updates from big banks.】

item.title: 英国通胀为何如此之高及其对利率的影响
item.description: 尽管大流行病后的通胀在发达国家的大部分地区有所缓解，但英国仍然是西方主要经济体中物价增长最快的国家。【原文：While a post-pandemic burst of inflation has abated across much of the developed world, Britain is still stuck with the highest price growth among big western economies.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司风险投资部门为沙特初创公司提供创纪录的人工智能融资支持
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）的风险投资机构Wa'ed Ventures为本地人工智能初创公司Lucidya提供了3000万美元的B轮融资，这是沙特王国人工智能公司最大的一笔融资。【原文：Saudi Aramco’s venture capital arm, Wa’ed Ventures, has backed a $30 million Series B funding round for local artificial intelligence startup Lucidya, marking the largest such raise by an artificial intelligence company in the kingdom.】

item.title: 埃及创纪录的柴油进口加剧了欧洲的供应压力
item.description: 本月，埃及柴油进口量创下新高，因为该国急于确保发电所需的备用燃料，这进一步紧缩了欧洲的供应。【原文：Egypt’s diesel imports have set new highs this month as the nation rushes to secure backup fuels for power generation, further tightening supplies in Europe.】

item.title: 稀土公司乌科雷将于五月开始路易斯安那工厂的生产
item.description: 加拿大乌科瑞稀有金属公司（Ucore Rare Metals Inc.【原文：Canada’s Ucore Rare Metals Inc. aims to start producing rare earth elements at a new Louisiana facility next May, boosting US processing capacity in an industry that’s currently dominated by China.】

item.title: 加沙援助点发生踩踏事件，造成汗尤尼斯枢纽站 20 人死亡
item.description: 周三，在加沙停火谈判进展甚微的同时，一个由以色列和美国支持的组织管理的援助物资分发点有 20 人丧生。【原文：Twenty people were killed Wednesday at an aid distribution site run by an Israeli and US-backed organization, while talks for a ceasefire in Gaza make little headway.】

item.title: 美国工业生产因公用事业产出回升而增长
item.description: 受公用事业产出跃升和制造业小幅增长的推动，美国 6 月份工业生产四个月来首次出现增长。【原文：US industrial production rose in June for the first time in four months, boosted by a jump in utility output and a modest gain in manufacturing.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称美元套期保值或将推动欧元升至 1.30 美元
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师认为，随着欧洲投资者寻求对冲近 4 万亿美元的美国资产，欧元的涨势将再次得到推动。【原文：The euro’s rally is about to get another boost, according to Morgan Stanley strategists, as European investors look to hedge nearly $4 trillion of US assets.】

item.title: 伦敦推动放宽股票出售规则为银行带来难题
item.description: 伦敦正在减少繁文缛节，使企业更容易进入股票市场，但投资银行表示，新规则可能会在短期内带来更多不确定性。【原文：London is cutting red tape to make it easier for companies to tap equity markets, but investment banks say the new rules could create more uncertainty in the near term.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行认为塞内加尔的债务负担在数据调整后有所减轻
item.description: 据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）称，塞内加尔沉重的债务负担已导致其信用评级在五个月内第二次被下调。【原文：Senegal’s heavy debt burden, which has triggered its second credit-rating downgrade in five months, could ease sharply when the government does a technical reset of economic data later this year, according to Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 欧盟提出 2028-2034 年接近 2 万亿欧元的预算草案
item.description: 欧盟为其下一个七年预算提出了近 2 万亿欧元（2.3 万亿美元）的预算，以应对从全球经济竞争加剧到国防需求增加等一系列挑战。【原文：The European Union has proposed a budget of close to €2 trillion ($2.3 trillion) for its next seven year budget, as it seeks to fend off a range of challenges from rising global economic competition to increased defense demands.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省省长称加拿大考虑限制木材出口以解决美国贸易争端
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚省领导人表示，加拿大官员愿意考虑限制向美国出口软木木材的数量，以努力解决两国之间的一些贸易摩擦。【原文：Canadian officials are open to considering limits on how much softwood lumber can be exported to the US to try to resolve some of the trade friction between the countries, according to the leader of British Columbia.】

item.title: 中国承诺解决电动汽车领域的 "非理性竞争 "问题
item.description: 中国承诺遏制电动汽车行业的 "非理性竞争"，这表明决策者担心价格战威胁经济增长。【原文：China pledged to rein in “irrational competition” in its electric vehicle industry, a sign policymakers are concerned about price wars threatening economic growth.】

item.title: 小肯尼迪美国最高卫生机构人事动荡，参谋长被撤换
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，卫生与公众服务部部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr.肯尼迪已任命马特-巴克汉姆（Matt Buckham）为代理幕僚长，立即生效。【原文：Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s chief of staff Heather Flick Melanson departed after six months in the role, according to people familiar with the matter. Kennedy has appointed Matt Buckham as acting chief of staff effective immediately.】

item.title: 美国生产者价格因服务成本下降而停滞不前
item.description: 美国 6 月份的批发通胀率变化不大，受制于服务业通胀率的下降，这表明企业正在吸收至少一部分因进口关税提高而产生的成本。【原文：US wholesale inflation was little changed in June, restrained by a decline in services that suggests companies are absorbing at least some of the costs from higher import duties.】

item.title: 法国银行建议将管制储蓄利率降至 1.7
item.description: 根据中央银行的建议，法国将下调其受欢迎的受管制储蓄产品的利率。【原文：France is set to cut the rate on its popular regulated savings products, following a recommendation from the central bank.】

item.title: 惠普企业与激进投资者埃利奥特签订协议
item.description: 惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.）宣布了几项业务变动，包括成立一个新的战略委员会和任命一名新的董事会成员，并同意与埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）合作，以帮助这家软件公司提升价值。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. announced several business changes, including the formation of a new strategy committee and the appointment of a new board member, as it agreed to work with Elliott Investment Management on ways to help the software company boost value.】

item.title: 印度 SBI 通过出售股份寻求 29.1 亿美元，条款显示
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的交易条款，印度资产规模最大的贷款机构印度国家银行正寻求通过向机构投资者出售股票筹集 29.1 亿美元。【原文：State Bank of India, the nation’s largest lender by assets, is seeking to raise $2.91 billion via a share sale to institutional investors, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 泰国将向美国提出避免关税的新建议
item.description: 泰国财政部长将在定于周三举行的会谈中向美国贸易官员提出新的建议，这是泰国为避免美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收 36% 关税所做的最新努力。【原文：Thailand’s finance minister will present fresh proposals to US trade officials in talks scheduled for Wednesday, the latest effort by the nation to avoid a 36% tariff threatened by President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 米莱收紧对阿根廷货币市场的控制，比索泛滥成灾
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱似乎放松了对经济中比索流通量的控制，在 10 月中期选举之前在通货膨胀和经济增长之间权衡利弊，阿根廷投资者开始预期阿根廷将出现微妙的政策变化。【原文：Investors in Argentina began to anticipate a subtle policy change as President Javier Milei seemed to ease his control of how many pesos circulate in the economy, a trade-off between inflation and economic growth ahead of October midterm elections.】

item.title: 美国主要地区天气干燥，玉米再次攀升
item.description: 玉米期货连续第三天上涨，因为预计美国部分地区天气将更加干燥，交易商急于平仓看跌押注。【原文：Corn futures rose for a third day as drier weather is expected in parts of the US and traders rushed to close out bearish bets.】

item.title: 彼得-蒂尔的创始人基金持有以太宝公司 BitMine 9.1% 的股份
item.description: 彼得-蒂尔的创始人基金持有 BitMine Immersion Technologies 公司 9.1% 的股份，该公司是一家在美国上市的比特币矿商，最近转向追求与以太币挂钩的财务战略。【原文：Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund holds a 9.1% stake in BitMine Immersion Technologies Inc., a US-listed Bitcoin miner that recently pivoted to pursue a treasury strategy tied to Ether.】

item.title: 六月份产量过剩之后，沙特阿拉伯面临石油减产抉择
item.description:
王国以中东紧张局势为由，每天抽油量比欧佩克+配额高出38.5万桶。【原文：

The kingdom pumped 385,000 barrels a day above its OPEC+ quota, citing Middle East tensions.

】

item.description: 英镑金融控股公司（Sterling Financial Holdings Co.【原文：Sterling Financial Holdings Co. aims to raise $400 million of capital in phases through multiple instruments and currencies to fund the Nigerian lender’s expansion.】

item.title: 意大利开发商科伊马公司首席执行官在米兰接受质询
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，意大利房地产开发商 Coima Sgr 的首席执行官面临质询，这是对米兰房地产开发中涉嫌腐败的广泛调查的一部分。【原文：The chief executive officer of Italian real estate developer Coima Sgr faces questioning as part of a broad probe of alleged corruption in property developments in Milan, according to people familiar with the matter.】
